section.title: Description
section.para: A slider-based action component is used for filtering table data.

listitem.para: Filter any UIData based component in dependency on its child's values
Fully skinnable control and input elements
Optional value text field with an attribute-managed position
Optional disablement of the component on a page
Optional toolTip to display the current value while a handle is dragged
Dragged state is stable after the mouse moves
Optional manual input possible if a text input field is present

section.title: Details of Usage
section.para: The dataFilterSlider component is bound to some UIData component using a "for" attribute and filters data in a table.
section.programlisting: ... <rich:dataFilterSlider sliderListener="#{mybean.doSlide}" startRange="0" endRange="50000" increment="10000" handleValue="1" for="carIndex" forValRef="inventoryList.carInventory" filterBy="getMileage" /> ... <h:dataTable id="carIndex"> ... </h:dataTable> ...
section.para: In this example other two attributes are used for filtering:

listitem.para: "forValRef" is a string which is used in a value attribute of the target UIData component. It's designed for resetting the UIData component back to the original list provided by a backing bean.
"filterBy" is a getter of an object member that is to be compared to a slider value. It's a value that is used in results filtering.

section.para: "handleValue" is an attribute for keeping the current handle position on the dataFilterSlider component. Based on the current value, appropriate values obtained from a getter method defined in "filterBy" are filtered.
One more important attribute is a "storeResults" one that allows the dataFilterSlider component to keep UIData target object in session.
If it's necessary the component submits a form on event of a handle state changing, use the "submitOnSlide" attribute. When the attribute definition is "true", submission on this event is defined.
Information about the "process" attribute usage you can find in the "Decide what to process " guide section.
